topic.title: Docker
topic.body:
1. Who uses it and for what purposes?
2. What features do you use?
3. How long have you used it and why did it interest you?
4. Have you used Vagrant before and can you compare the problems?
5. Do you keep such things separately as cache, logs, project dependencies (eg vendor folder, node_modules)?

topic.title: Has ZeroNet some progress?
topic.body: I have no seen obvious augmentation of activity from last summer in ZeroNet... What do you may say about it?

topic.title: Personal archive.org (decentralized network)
topic.body: Problem of existing decentralized networks such as ZeroNet is that they need a lot of extra effort to support and almost no one need they until he or she no problem with internet connection and government don't block a necessary resources. Really usefull decentralized network must be at least backup of plain Internet and use plain Internet URL to identify resources. For example this DecNet have Chrome extension that send every URL that an user visit to user's local DecNet peer application that backup it. DecNet peer time to time updates information on all URLs so user have always actual copy of information he or she need. When plain Internet becomes unavailable user may receive updates by decentrilized way. The problem of truth source exists in this model but information availability is more important than authenticity. For authenticity check may exists dozens of add-ons on this DecNet
